author: K. Campbell
title: Yelp to List Businesses That Don’t Offer “Gender-Neutral” Bathrooms
text:
Students’ Trump Chant at Basketball Game Labeled “Racially Motivated” 
“We will also be rolling out the ability to search for businesses on Yelp by the Gender Neutral Restrooms attribute in the weeks to come,” Rachel Williams, head of diversity and inclusion at Yelp, wrote Friday on an official company blog post. 
The review website described a “gender-neutral” restroom as one that is single-stall, lockable, and accessible to any gender, excluding any businesses that still have the traditional “men” and “women” bathrooms. 
Yelp officials said they would gather such information in two main ways.   
Patrons of a business can virtually “check in” on the Yelp website or app and notify the review company about the business’ restroom situation and whether there was a gender-neutral bathroom available. 
Alternatively, owners of businesses can edit their Yelp user accounts to indicate that they provide unisex restrooms at their establishments. 
We have seen how liberals have attacked conservative businesses online that have refused to back down from their political beliefs, and it often becomes an inappropriate attack on the business itself instead of the owners who hold those beliefs. 
For example, a conservative-owned restaurant that doesn’t have gender-neutral restrooms could be negatively reviewed by liberals who disagree with the restroom policy, but those who later view the business’s Yelp page would only see the negative review and not the political reason behind it.
